name: Google - Grid enhancements Plus
description: A style I was originally going to integrate into this, but then figured it was beyond the scope of that style, so I made a new style for it instead. Do also pair with this style which hides the Google Grid scrollbar, as it looks ugly otherwise. This style comes after the rollout of a new Google feature known as Google Grid, a button that provides one-click access to other Google services, and is basically a modernized revamp of the "More" menu, with a link to a page with all available Google services. This style is ideal for using a background on the Google front page.
additional_info: Information Latest major update: 12/22/14 Latest minor update: 12/23/14 Works best with this. Alternatively, Customizable Minimal Scrollbars if you want a floating scrollbar for the entire browser. Even has autohide settings! Worked primarily on U.S. Google, users in other countries may have to tweak the style to fit. Out of my control. Ideally made for bright images that do not predominantly use black. If you are using a very dark image or black background, feel free to tweak the RGB values for each instance of background-color to be white (255,255,255) or whatever else you're aiming for. Don't limit yourself, have fun with it! I expect people to use this as a template of some sort for other themes. I don't even mind if I get no credit for it, but I do appreciate the nod if you're willing to give it. This new plus release doesn't just affect Google Grid, it also modifies how the other Google+ widgets look. Textboxes remain relatively the same, just modified to fit the width of the widget they are in. (More) Localization You can modify the text in line 366; Modify it to your locale's expression for removing the end time in Event. Known bugs - Share > Link: Input field doesn't occupy the entire container it is in. Resolved - Share > Invite: Graphical header and time / endtime does not fill entire container. Resolved - Cancel button has odd highlight to it. It's a Google thing, and should have been an easy fix. Resolved - Repositioned cancel button can be out of view for some people. Go to line 160 and edit the margin there until it's just right. Resolved; manieKMP supplied a fix that should work universally - Share > Video: Thumbnail still looks ugly, as does the "Remove" button and close button. Resolved - When time zone menu is invoked, it hides the prompt to remove end time. Resolved. Not how I'd have expected it, but sometimes the simplest solution is the best. People using my Simple Background Image Code style will have underlines on all the links outside of the special Google+ stuff because that's what I specified for it. So some parts of the code get overridden by that. Changelog 03/19/14 Fixed link section menu, that is now fully complete. 03/20/14 Reverted cancel button position due to use concerns of blocking important functions. 03/22/14.1 Cancel button changes restored, with the important privacy warning stuff moved (hopefully). If there are issues, create a discussion thread and I will be sure to see it! 03/22/14.2 Adjusted padding and margins for some things, nothing big. 03/23/14 manieKMP once again helped out, providing code to complete the Event section in the share dialog, and removing the outline from the cancel button. The "End time" close button is now a text-only link, change the text to your language at line 303 and play with spacing afterward. 03/24/14.1 More little changes by manieKMP, position and appearance changes to close buttons in event and video, and some other little changes making this better and better. 03/24/14.2 Centered picture output in Photos, positioned close buttons, moved "Add end time" in Event to where "Remove end time" is. Also added a fix in Event when time zone is selected, which made the "Remove end time" prompt disappear. Redacted. 03/24/14.3 More of the same; Little changes, and the timezone issue is finally resolve. Also, fixed the more buttons and bottom grid container. 04/09/2014 here we go with Google's carousel of death ever-changing classes... 04/15/2014 Yep. Why won't Google stop? 04/23/2014 I got it done eventually. After the Easter rush and stuff and stuff and stuff, I took out some time to completely reconfigure the grid and make everything work once again. Thank you, Google for never stopping the ride and keeping the bullcrap up. >:( 05/21/2014 Google did some bad stuff that affected the top toolbar on their homepage. Resolved. 05/30/2014 Simple fix to remove the little bit of stuff that was at the upper right of the share widget. 06/23/2014 Due to familial issues, I am unable to provide the same constant love and attention I had given to this style in the past. I've got it working well enough for now, will do more with it later. 06/29/2014 Major update, small fix for G+ pages by editing the share widget stuff; Some text box there was linked to a share widget class and an exception was added there. Also added a "Minor update" date because Google does so much small stuff which doesn't quantify as a major update, and any "Minor" updates will be class changes, most likely to the Google Grid widget. Google has been too good with not changing anything for their share widget. Thank goodness. 07/08/2014 Fixed a fatal class issue that made the Google widgets unusable, other class changes. 08/06/2014 After nearly a month, it was looking pretty bad. So I fixed it! Also brute-forced centering items to make things look pretty in the new configuration. Should look okay. Also somehow figured out a way to keep the look when dragging items around. 09/22/2014 Class changes. 12/22/2014 Near the end of the year! I decided to stop concentrating on one website in favor for what use to be my bread and butter on here, fixing the Google Grid and adding new code for the "Poll" share entry. Also made code spacing consistent. 12/23/2014 Added border-color specification for the accounts panel to match, and slight adjustment to the poll top text input. Also fixed the button hover in the grid and added hover in the account panel buttons. 01/17/2015 Extensive class changes.

discussions.name: It's been too long, and I'm sorry for that.
